method.text: In a bowl, beat the cream cheese to soften slightly. Stir in the diced cucumber, lemon rind, dill and pepper to taste.

Cut the salmon slices into equal squares (one per person) measuring approximately 12 cm. Or, if the slices are very thin, use 2 thin lengths per parcel, each measuring 12cm long. Place on top of each other to form a cross shape.
Divide the filling mixture between the salmon squares, spooning into the centre of each. Wrap the salmon around the filling to incorporate it, just like a parcel.
Turn the salmon parcels up the other way so their joins are underneath. Loosely tie each with 2 lengths of chive.  Garnish with fresh dill and lemon slices.
